text: Dame Judith Anderson AC DBE (10 February 1897 â€“ 3 January 1992) was an Australian actress. She lived in the United States and performed on stage, television and movies. She received two Emmy Awards and a Tony Award for her acting. Her Hollywood movies included the Academy Award-nominated movie Rebecca, Laura in 1944 and The Diary of a Chambermaid in 1946. Anderson was born in Adelaide, South Australia, although she later relocated to Santa Barbara, California. Anderson died of pneumonia at 94. ==References== Category:1897 births Category:1992 deaths Category:Actors from Adelaide Category:Australian television actors Category:Australian movie actors Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Emmy Award winning actors Category:Infectious disease deaths in California Category:Knights and Dames Commander of the Order of the British Empire Category:Tony Award winning actors
title: Judith Anderson
